info.title: AngusGM RESTFul OpenAPI Documentation
info.description: AngusGM OpenAPI Documentation is a comprehensive, standards-compliant technical reference  that provides detailed specifications for all API endpoints, including authentication methods,  request/response schemas (with JSON/XML examples), HTTP status codes, error handling patterns, and interactive testing capabilities through Swagger UI integration, designed to empower developers  with version-controlled documentation for seamless third-party system integration.

tags.name: App
tags.description: Manages application configurations and lifecycle processes.

tags.name: SettingTenantQuota
tags.description: Assigns and initializes tenant resource quotas based on predefined policies or payment order.

tags.name: Setting
tags.description: Centralizes system-wide settings for unified control and consistency.

tags.name: Tenant
tags.description: Unified tenant management. Centralizes tenant account controls, configurations, and initialize access permissions, etc.

tags.name: SettingUser
tags.description: Provides user-specific configuration access for personalized settings within authorized limits.

tags.name: MessageCurrent
tags.description: Manages current individual user interactions with messages, including deletion, read status, and retrieval.

tags.name: AuthUser
tags.description: Administers OAuth2 user identities and authorization grants.

tags.name: AppOrgAuth
tags.description: Retrieves user-specific application access permissions within an organization.

tags.name: AuthPolicy
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for authorization policies management. Authorization policies control access to resources and define permissions for users and applications.

tags.name: ServiceApi
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for managing Angus series application services and associated apis.

tags.name: AuthUserToken
tags.description: Controls user token issuance, validation, and revocation.

tags.name: TORole
tags.description: Operational role management. Streamlines organizational efficiency by defining responsibilities, coordinating workflows, and aligning permissions with business objectives.

tags.name: AuthPolicyFunc
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between functions (button,  menus, panel) and authorization policies.

tags.name: EventTemplate
tags.description: This category handles event template configurations, including predefined settings for receivers, notification channels.

tags.name: Notice
tags.description: Application (or system) notice management, used for delivers real-time push and updates across application to inform users of critical events, required actions, or information changes.

tags.name: UserCurrent
tags.description: Personal center current user operation api entry.

tags.name: Email
tags.description: Handles email message delivery operations, and audit logging for tracking sent communications.

tags.name: AuthPolicyGroup
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between groups and authorization policies.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Unified user management entry for the system.

tags.name: EmailTemplate
tags.description: Standardizes email content creation through reusable templates with dynamic variables and multi-language support, maintaining brand consistency and operational efficiency.

tags.name: OperationLog
tags.description: Provides a unified api for query user operation logs.

tags.name: TenantCertAudit
tags.description: Verifies and audits tenant identity documents to ensure compliance and authenticity.

tags.name: TenantCertRecognize
tags.description: Validates official IDs or business licenses via third-party APIs for automated authentication.

tags.name: AnalysisCustomization
tags.description: Customized definition statistical analysis implementation apis, used to query supported analysis resource definition information and to retrieve analysis and statistical information.

tags.name: AuthPolicyDept
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between departments and authorization policies.

tags.name: DeptUser
tags.description: Controls department-to-user membership mappings to regulate user visibility and access privileges based on organizational departments.

tags.name: Client
tags.description: Manages OAuth2 client registrations. The OAuth2 client acts on behalf of the user to request resource access permissions and securely exchange credentials for access tokens to interact with protected APIs.

tags.name: UserGroup
tags.description: Controls user-to-group membership mappings to regulate user visibility and access privileges based on organizational groups.

tags.name: UserDept
tags.description: Controls user-to-department membership mappings to regulate user visibility and access privileges based on organizational departments.

tags.name: EmailServer
tags.description: Email server configuration management, authentication protocols, and delivery policies to ensure reliable, compliant email communication across systems.

tags.name: UserDirectory
tags.description: User directory service management for system LDAP unified authentication login.

tags.name: Event
tags.description: enable retrieval of historical event records and associated channel configurations. Users can filter, sort, and paginate event logs, while also querying configured event channels to audit event routing and processing workflows.

tags.name: SmsTemplate
tags.description: Standardizes sms content creation through reusable templates with dynamic variables and multi-language support, maintaining brand consistency and operational efficiency.

tags.name: ApiLog
tags.description: Inspects recorded API transaction details for auditing or debugging.

tags.name: SystemLog
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for managing system logs (/actuator/systemlog).

tags.name: Service
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for managing Angus series application services.

tags.name: SettingTenant
tags.description: Manages tenant-level configurations to customize shared settings across their ecosystem.

tags.name: AuthPolicyApp
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between applications and authorization policies.

tags.name: ServiceDiscovery
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying AngusDiscovery (Service Registration Center) services and instances information.

tags.name: EventChannel
tags.description: Manage event notification channels such as Webhooks, WeChat robots, and DingTalk robots.

tags.name: UserTag
tags.description: Assigns tags to user for resource categorization, or query access control grouping.

tags.name: Country
tags.description: Query for supported country entrances.

tags.name: DeptTag
tags.description: Assigns tags to department for resource categorization, or query access control grouping.

tags.name: GroupUser
tags.description: Controls group-to-user membership mappings to regulate user visibility and access privileges based on organizational groups.

tags.name: AuthPolicyTenant
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between tenant, application and authorization policies.

tags.name: AppOpen
tags.description: Enable automated onboarding and configuration of applications, granting authorized access to resources based on organizational/user permissions while enforcing security policies.

tags.name: TenantSign
tags.description: Processes secure tenant account termination with data cleanup and permission revocation.

tags.name: MessageCenter
tags.description: Message center unified message dispatch. Enables centralized message distribution across multiple users from a single api.

tags.name: AppFuncTag
tags.description: Provides tags management operation of application function (including application, menus, button and panel).

tags.name: Message
tags.description: Handles the lifecycle (send, delete, query) and targeted distribution of messages to diverse organizational entities.

tags.name: AppFunc
tags.description: Organizes system function (menus, button, panel) and permission assignments.

tags.name: AppTag
tags.description: Assigns and categorizes applications using metadata tags.

tags.name: Sms
tags.description: Handles sms message delivery operations, and audit logging for tracking sent communications.

tags.name: Dept
tags.description: Manages department organizational unit creation, modification, and hierarchical structure maintenance, etc.

tags.name: MessageCenterOnline
tags.description: Monitors real-time user online statuses, such as querying online users or forced logouts.

tags.name: SystemToken
tags.description: System access tokens are digital "ID cards" that temporarily grant users or apps specific permissions to access systems or data. They act like a secure, time-limited passcodeâ€”unlike traditional passwords, tokens verify identity AND control exactly what actions are allowed (e.g. "read-only access for 1 hour").

tags.name: CountryDistrict
tags.description: Query for supported district entrances.

tags.name: SmsChannel
tags.description: Provides management for third-party SMS channel configuration. If the SMS cannot be sent, please confirm whether the corresponding plugin for the SMS channel is installed or if the SMS template is correct.

tags.name: Group
tags.description: Manages group organizational unit creation, modification, and status maintenance, etc.

tags.name: CombinedNotice
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for users to send messages, such as in-site message, SMS, and email.

tags.name: GroupTag
tags.description: Assigns tags to group for resource categorization, or query access control grouping.

tags.name: Api
tags.description: Controls API endpoint definitions and access policies.

tags.name: TOUserRole
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying or authorizing the relationship between users and operational roles.

tags.name: AuthPolicyUser
tags.description: Provides a unified entry for querying the relationship between users and authorization policies.

tags.name: TOUser
tags.description: Provides an entry for managing operational users in the cloud service edition (SaaS).

ApiResultObject.description: These parameters collectively create a structured response that provides a clear and informative way for clients to understand the result of their API calls, including the status, any relevant messages, the response data, processing time, and any additional context needed for proper handling of the response.

msg.description: This parameter contains a message that provides additional context or information about the API response. This could be a success message, an error description, or any other relevant information that helps the client understand the result of the request.

data.description: This parameter holds the actual data returned by the API, which is typically the result or exception trace of the requested operation.

datetime.description: This parameter represents the server's processing time for the request, formatted as a date-time string. This information can be useful for clients to log when the request was processed or for troubleshooting purposes, as it indicates how long the server took to respond.

ext.description: This parameter is an extensible map that can hold additional information related to the response that doesn't fit into the predefined fields. It allows for flexibility in the API response by enabling the inclusion of extra data that may be useful for the client.

mainDept.description: Whether or not main department flag.

deptHead.description: Whether or not department head flag.

id.description: User id. The ID is required when modifying an existing user, create a new user when the value is empty.

password.description: User signup password, used to log in to the system through the password.

signupType.description: User signup(registration) type. Note: Modification not allowed.

signupAccount.description: Account used during user signup(registration). The value is email or mobile. Note: Modification not allowed.

sysAdmin.description: Whether or not system administrator flag. Note: Modification not allowed.

enabled.description: Whether or not user enabled flag.

invitationCode.description: Platform invitation code, used to register the current user to an existing tenant account. Note: Modification not allowed.

depts.description: User's departments information, the maximum support is `2000`.

groupIds.description: User's group ids, the maximum support is `2000`.

tagIds.description: User association tag ids, the maximum support is `2000`.

objectClass.description: LDAP attribute objectClass value to search for when loading groups

descriptionAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading the group description

ignoreSameNameGroup.description: If true ignore the same name group, otherwise, save the same name group

memberGroupAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading a user's groups

baseDn.description: Base DN, Root node in LDAP from which to search for users and groups.

additionalUserDn.description: Additional User DN, Prepended to the base DN to limit the scope when searching for users.

additionalGroupDn.description: Additional Group DN, Prepended to the base DN to limit the scope when searching for groups.

host.description: Hostname of the server running LDAP

ssl.description: Whether to use SSL flag, default false

objectClass.description: The LDAP user object class type to use when loading users

objectFilter.description: The filter to use when searching user objects

usernameAttribute.description: Attribute field corresponding to user unique name

lastNameAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading the user last name

displayNameAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading the user full name (Fullname)

emailAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading the user email

mobileAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when loading the user mobile

passwordAttribute.description: The attribute field to use when manipulating a user password

passwordEncoderType.description: Choose the encryption algorithm used for passwords on your directory

ignoreSameIdentityUser.description: Force ignore the same identity(unique name, email, mobile) user

Application type.

***BASE_APP (Core Base Applications)***: Provide essential system functionalities and foundational services (e.g., authentication, data storage, system management) critical for platform operations.

id.description: Client primary key id. Automatically generate a UUID string value if not specified.

clientId.description: OAuth2 registered client identifier. The clientId uniquely identifies an application to the OAuth2 server, enabling authorization and token requests.

clientIdIssuedAt.description: The time at which the client identifier was issued.

clientSecret.description: OAuth2 registered client secret or null if not available. The client secret securely authenticates the application's identity, ensuring only trusted clients access protected resources.

clientSecretExpiresAt.description: The time at which the client secret expires or null if it does not expire..

clientAuthenticationMethods.description: The authentication method(s) that the client may use.

postLogoutRedirectUris.description: The post logout redirect URI(s) that the client may use for logout. The post_logout_redirect_uri parameter is used by the client when requesting that the End-User's User Agent be redirected to after a logout has been performed.

scopes.description: The scope(s) that the client may use.

platform.description: The platform used by the client.

tenantId.description: The client used by the tenant (id), effective for all tenants when the value is empty..

tenantName.description: The client used by the tenant (name).
